description: From Irish meadar, from Old Irish metar, from Latin metrum. Doublet of meter.

entries.meaning: (historical, Ireland) A communal drinking vessel used in Gaelic times for drinking mead. It had squared sides and one drank from a corner. Also, a trophy in this shape.
examples: I raise to you, O Queen, this Loving Cup, this Mether,
Made from honey of the heather
